mechanical devices 2 all discharge from the detention facility when inflow is equal or less than the largest applicable design storm inflow shall be via the primary outlet 3 the design discharge rate via the outlet shall continuously increase with increasing head and shall have hydraulic characteristics similar to weirs orifices or pipes 4 for dry detention basins the design shall allow for discharge of at least eighty percent 80% of the detention storage volume within twentyfour 24 hours after the peak or center of mass of the inflow has entered the detention basin 5 ponds shall be designed with a nonclogging outlet such as a reverseslope pipe or a weir outlet with a trash rack a reverseslope pipe draws from below the permanent pool extending in a reverse angle up to the riser and established water elevation of the permanent pool because these outlet draw water from below the level of the permanent pool they are less likely to be clogged by floating debris 6 all opening shall be protected by trash racks grates stone filters or other approved devices to ensure that the outlet works will remain functional 7 if a detention basin is to be used as a water quality bmp the basins must be sized to detain the entire water quality storm such that the entire water quality storm leaves the basin no sooner than forty 40 hours after the start of the rainfall event e emergency spillways the emergency spillway may either be combined with the outlet works or be a separate structure or channel meeting the following criteria 1 elevation emergency spillways shall be designed so that their crest elevation is onehalf foot 05 or more above the maximum water surface elevation in the detention facility attained by the largest applicable design storm 2 capacity  in cases where the impoundmentemergency spillway is not regulated by either state or federal agencies the emergency spillway shall be designed to pass the one percent 1% storm with one foot 1 of freeboard from the design stage to the top of the dam assuming zero 0 available storage in the basin and zero 0 flow primary outlet this design provides and added level of protection in the event of a clogged primary outlet or a subsequent one percent 1% storm event that occurs before the flow pool from the initial storm even recedes to the principal outlet elevation f draw down provision drain works consisting of valves gates pipes and other devices as necessary to completely drain the facility in seventytwo 72 hours or less when required for maintenance or inspection shall be provided g erosion control  primary outlet works emergency spillways and drain works as well as conveyance system entrances to detention basins shall be equipped with energy dissipating devices as necessary to limit shear stresses on receiving channels see tables 56051 and 56062 for shear stress criteria h detention basins detention basins designed to accommodate the one percent 1% storm event shall not be combined with bioretention i the manual of best management practices for stormwater quality the manual of best management practices for stormwater quality dated september 2003 and published by the midamerica regional council and the american public works association is hereby incorporated by reference for the purpose of providing guidance for planning and implementing best management practices that will control volumes and quality of stormwater discharges and thereby provide crucial assistance in protecting human life and property maintaining overall water quality and for creating more environmentally sensitive site design j official copy filed one copy of this document shall be marked or stamped official copy and filed with the city clerk to be open to inspection and available to the public at all reasonable hours the selected bmps must be properly integrated into the overall landscape design providing aesthetic value in addition to the desired function it is understood that required planting areas may need to be increased to accommodate stormwater management practices k applicability of these standards  these standards shall apply to all development occurring in the city after the effective date of the ordinance from which this section is derived  provided however that the standards shall not apply to 1 land which is covered by an approved development plan or final plat where approval was given on or before  and where construction of any approved detention facility was begun on or before that date  or 2 land which is covered by an approved preliminary plan or preliminary plat where approval was given on or before  and where construction of any approved detention facility was not yet begun on that date shall only be required to comply with such standards by modifying said detention basin to provide fifty percent 50% ten percent 10% and one percent 1% storm protection and appropriate clean stormwater bmps but only to the extent that the modification does not change the lot count or significantly alter the character of any lots shown on the approved preliminary plan or plat notwithstanding the foregoing if any development plan or plat covering land exempted pursuant to subsections e1 and 2 of this section is amended to a substantial or material degree compliance with these standards shall be required prior    performance bonds and other assurances for completion of stormwater management improvements upon approval of the final stormwater management plan but before the issuance of the engineering permit the public works director shall require the applicant to post a performance bond cash escrow certified check or other acceptable form of performance guaranty for the amount of the work to be done pursuant to the approved stormwater management plan prior    maintenance bond a two 2 year maintenance bond against defects in material and workmanship may be required by the city for any portion of the stormwater management improvements dedicated to the public prior    inspection and maintenance the public works director shall be responsible for determining whether the stormwater management plan is in conformance with requirements specified in whether development is proceeding in accordance with the approved stormwater management plan 1 inspection a inspection during construction 1 the public works director or third party inspector hired by the developer shall inspect the stormwater management systems during all critical phases of construction these phases may include grading installation of pipes and structures and plantinglandscaping 2 stormwater management system components andor grading are part of public improvements and shall be inspected as such even if the system will be owned and maintained by private entities all system components shall be substantially complete prior to issuing any building permits unless otherwise stated in the developer agreement or plans b periodic inspection by city the public works director shall be authorized to inspect all stormwater management systems during the first year of operation and at least once every three 3 years thereafter the public works director shall notify in writing any property owner of any violations that are found during the inspections pursuant to the criteria set forth in this division c annual inspection by private owner the owners of the property containing private stormwater management systems installed pursuant to this division shall have all stormwater management systems inspected on an annual basis on or before may 1 of each year the owner of each stormwater management system shall furnish certification by an engineer licensed by the state to the city engineer that all stormwater management systems are functioning in accordance with the approved plans all certifications and inspections shall be on forms provided by the city the certification shall contain the following 1 the name and address of the landowner  2 the recorded book and page number of the lot of each stormwater management system  3 a statement that an inspection was made of all stormwater management systems  4 the date the inspection was made  5 a statement that all inspected stormwater management systems are performing properly and are in compliance with the terms and conditions of the stormwater management plan required by this division  and 6 the original signature and seal of the engineer 2 maintenance a responsibility for maintenance the owners of the property containing private stormwater management systems shall be responsible for maintenance of those systems in the cases where there is joint maintenance provided by the city and the property owner the city shall be responsible for structural maintenance only as specified on the plans and in the developermaintenance agreement for the specific systems b maintenance agreement whenever a stormwater management plan is required for property pursuant hereto no building permit shall be issued until the owner of the private stormwater management system executes a maintenance agreement to be recorded in the land records and binding upon all subsequent owners of the property providing that 1 the property owner shall maintain all stormwater management systems in accordance with the establishment and maintenance plan 2 the property owner shall permit the city to inspect the stormwater management systems at any time 3 the property owner shall correct any violations in the system 4 if the city intends to make corrections as a result of violations at the property owners expense as allowed under this division the property owner will provide access to the stormwater management system prior    action upon noncompliance a enforcement during construction 1 if it is determined that development is not proceeding in accordance with the approved stormwater management plan the public works director shall issue written notice to the developer and the surety of the nature and location of the alleged noncompliance specifying what remedial work is necessary to bring the project into compliance and setting forth the time period allowed to correct the noncompliance the written notice shall be accompanied by documentary evidence demonstrating noncompliance the developer so notified shall unless weather conditions or other factors beyond the control of the permittee prevent immediate remedial action commence the recommended remedial action and shall complete the remedial work within the time allotted by the city upon satisfactory completion of the remedial work the public works director shall issue a notice of compliance and the development may proceed 2 if the permittee or landowner fails to make the required corrections within the time period allotted by the city the public works director may post a stop work order at the site directing that all construction activity cease immediately for the purposes of this section a stop work order is effective upon posting a copy of the stop work order on the site a person must not continue or permit the continuance of work in an area covered by a stop work order except work required to correct violations under this division no inspections shall be performed and no additional permits will be issued by the city for the site while a stop work order is in effect any person who shall continue to work after a stop work order has been posted except such work as that person is directed by the city to perform to remove a violation or unsafe condition is guilty of a public offense and may be subject to penalties as prescribed in this article 3 the city must provide written notice to the permittee or a representative of the permittee when a stop work order is issued a copy of the order in the case of work for which there is a permit shall be mailed by first class mail postage prepaid to the address listed by the permittee on the permit in the case of work for which there is no permit a copy of the order shall be mailed to the person listed as owner of the property by the county land records that notice must specify the extent to which work is stopped and the conditions under which work may resume the permittee is responsible for the actions of agents of the permittee and must notify those agents when a stop work order is issued that will affect an area within which the agents are to work in this regard the term agent is defined as any person who acts at the instruction with the permission or to the benefit of the permittee 4 failure of the permittee to make the necessary corrections within ten 10 days after a stop work order is posted shall constitute a public offense and is punishable as prescribed in this division upon such failure the city may a issue a notice to appear setting a date and time for appearance in municipal court the public works director and the public works director and their designees shall have authority to issue a notice to appear under this division the city may seek all criminal and civil penalties allowed by this chapter as well as any injunctive relief that may be appropriate  andor b correct or abate the violation 5 if the city performs work to correct a violation of this division the costs incurred by the city to perform this work shall be paid by the owner or permittee out of the performance guaranty required by if the cost of the work necessary to correct the violation exceeds the amount of the performance guaranty the permittee shall continue to be firmly bound under a continuing obligation for payment of all excess costs and expenses incurred by the city the cost of necessary work in excess of the performance guaranty shall be certified by the city clerk to the county clerk and shall to the extent authorized by law become a lien upon all property and all rights to property real or personal of any person liable to pay that cost the cost of necessary work shall be listed on the tax bill and be collected in the manner of ordinary taxes to the extent authorized by law in the event no performance guaranty was posted the cost plus interest at the rate authorized by the city plus a reasonable administrative fee shall be billed to the owner if in any event the amount due is not paid the city clerk shall certify the amount due to the county clerk and it shall in accordance with law become a lien upon all property and all rights to property real or personal of any person liable to pay the amount due this amount shall be listed on the tax bill and be collected in the manner of ordinary taxes as authorized by law 6 the public works director and his designee shall have authority but not the obligation to issue additional notices and extend the time given to a permittee to perform any action required under this section b enforcement of maintenance requirements 1 when a property owner violates the maintenance requirements of this section the public works director or his designee shall notify the property owner in writing of the nature and location of the violation describe the required corrective action and the time period to have the violation corrected failure of the property owner to make the necessary corrections within the specified timeframe shall constitute a public offense and is punishable as prescribed in this division 2 if after receiving notice of a violation of maintenance requirements a property owner fails to perform the required corrective action within the time prescribed in the notice of violation the city may a issue a notice to appear setting a date and time for appearance in municipal court the public works director and the public works directors designees shall have authority to issue a notice to appear under this division the city may seek all criminal and civil penalties allowed by this chapter as well as any injunctive relief that may be appropriate  andor b correct or abate the violation 3 if the city performs work to correct a violation of this division the property owner shall be liable for the costs incurred by the city to perform this work within thirty 30 days after performing the work necessary to correct the violation the city shall issue a written notice containing the nature of the work performed the date the work was performed the cost of such work and a statement that the property owner must pay for the cost of the work within thirty 30 days to avoid having a lien filed against the property the cost to correct the violation plus interest at the rate authorized by the city plus a reasonable administrative fee shall be billed to the property owner if in any event the amount due is not paid the city clerk shall certify the amount due to the county clerk and it shall in accordance with law become a lien upon all property and all rights to property real or personal of any person liable to pay the amount due this amount shall be listed on the tax bill and be collected in the manner of ordinary taxes as authorized by law c enforcement against homes associations 1 for purposes of this division the term homes association shall mean an organization representing property owners within a planned development that is responsible for the ownership and maintenance of a stormwater management system 2 if a homes association fails to correct a violation within the time period identified in this section then the city may choose any of the remedies provided in this section if the city performs work to correct a violation of this division the homes association shall be responsible for the costs incurred by the city to perform this work within thirty 30 days after performing the work necessary to correct the violation the city shall issue a written notice containing the nature of the work performed the date the work was performed the cost of such work and a statement that the association must pay for the cost of the work within thirty 30 days to avoid having a lien filed against the property if the homes association fails to pay for the cost of the work within thirty 30 days after receiving the notice the city shall hold a public hearing for the purpose of determining how the cost of the work shall be assessed against the properties within the planned development all property owners represented by the homes association shall be given notice of such hearing after determining how the cost of work shall be assessed the city clerk shall certify the amount due by each property owner within the planned development to the county clerk and it shall in accordance with law become a lien upon all property and all rights to property real or personal of any person liable to pay the amount due this amount shall be listed on the tax bill and be collected in the manner of ordinary taxes as authorized by law d offenses any person who violates a provision of this division fails to comply with any of the requirements thereof or fails to comply with a directive of the city as authorized by this division is guilty of a public offense and shall be subject to penalties as provided in in addition the city may seek such additional remedies as are allowed by law prior    appeals any person aggrieved by a decision of the public works director may appeal any order requirement decision or determination as set forth below 1 a written request shall be submitted within ten 10 working days to the public works director the public works director shall notify the person in writing of his decision within a reasonable time after receiving the appeal 2 decision of the public works director may be appealed to the mayor or his designee as follows a a written request shall be submitted to the mayor within fourteen 14 working days of the public works directors decision b the mayor may 1 accept the request and direct the public works director to issue an approval  or 2 deny the request and accept the decision of the public works director c the mayor shall act on the appeal within a reasonable time after receiving the appeal 3 the decision of the mayor shall be considered final no further appeal will be permitted prior    minimum standards the performance standards and design criteria set forth in this division establish minimum requirements which must be implemented with good engineering practice and workmanship depending upon the individual circumstances additional design criteria and performance standards may be necessary use of the requirements contained in this division shall not constitute a representation guarantee or warranty of any kind by the city or its officers and employees of the adequacy or safety or any stormwater management structure or use of land nor shall it constitute approval of damages caused by stormwater runoff the degree of protection required by this division is considered reasonable for regulatory purposes and is based on historical records engineering and scientific methods of study larger storms may occur or stormwater runoff heights may be increased by manmade or natural causes this division therefore shall not create liability on the part of the city or any officer with respect to any legislative or administrative decision lawfully made hereunder prior    violation and penalties unless otherwise provided penalties for violations of this article shall be assessed as provided in prior    zoning and land development footnotes  1  state law reference planning and zoning ksa 12741 et seq article i  in general title this chapter shall be known as the fairway development ordinances it is organized according to generally applicable provisions  planning provisions  land division provisions  zoning provisions  and building provisions  the fairway development ordinances is inclusive of all future amendments as provided in this chapter or otherwise provided by law development  authorization the governing body hereby provides for the adoption or amendment of plans planning and zoning laws and regulations and building regulations in the manner provided for in this chapter and in the state statutes the governing body may divide the city into districts of such number shape area and of such different classes according to the use of land and buildings and the intensity character and appearance of such use or buildings this chapter is adopted under the authority of the state statutes and any amendments thereto and other applicable authority development  general purpose the purpose of this chapter is to protect the health safety and welfare of the citizens by 1 making or causing to be made a comprehensive plan for the development and redevelopment of the city 2 developing regulations that provide for the a efficient and orderly location of streets  b reduction of vehicular congestion  c reservation or dedication of land for open spaces  d offsite and onsite public improvements  e recreational facilities which may include but are not limited to the dedication of land area for park purposes  f flood protection  g building lines  h compatibility of design  i stormwater runoff including consideration of historic and anticipated 100year rain and snowfall precipitation records and patterns  and j any other services facilities and improvements deemed appropriate 3 developing zoning regulations that restrict regulate and specify a the height number of stories and size of buildings  b the percentage of each lot that may be occupied  c the size of yards courts and other open spaces  d the density of population  the location use and appearance of buildings structures and land for residential commercial industrial and other purposes  the conservation of natural resources including agricultural land  and e the use of land located in areas designated as floodplains and other areas including the distance of any buildings and structures from a street or highway 4 adopting zoning regulations which may a provide for planned unit developments  b permit the transfer of development rights  c preserve structures and districts listed on the local state or national historic register  d control the aesthetics of redevelopment or new developments  e provide for the issuance of special use or conditional use permits  and f establish overlay zones 5 adopting any other standards and regulations relating to planning zoning and building in the city that bring about the health safety and welfare of the citizens development  general applicability and interpretation the provisions of this chapter shall be liberally construed to effectively carry out its purposes which are hereby found and declared to be in furtherance of the public health safety welfare and convenience these regulations and the standards and procedures set out herein shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion and protection of health safety and welfare of the public the regulations in this chapter supplement and are in addition to all other laws ordinances or regulations in effect or which may be adopted subsequently on any subject matter in this chapter when the conditions imposed by this chapter on any building structure or parcel of land are overlapping or contradictory with any other law ordinance regulation or rule the more restrictive provision shall govern when conditions imposed by this chapter on any building structure or parcel of land are overlapping or contradictory with any other provision in this chapter the more restrictive provision shall apply  provided it is determined that the more restrictive provision is most consistent with the general purpose of this chapter development  applicability to the city all buildings structures or uses owned or operated by the city shall be exempted from the regulations of this chapter and shall be permitted in any zoning district  provided that the plans are submitted and approved in accordance with site plan procedures of division 1 of this chapter or where applicable the development plan procedures in division 4 and plans are determined to be consistent with the purposes of this chapter  and further provided that the planning commission makes any required review for any public improvement public facility or public utility in accordance with the comprehensive plan provisions set out in this chapter development  private agreements this chapter is not intended to abrogate annul or void any easement covenant restriction or other private agreement  provided when the regulations herein impose a higher standard on any property within the city then these regulations shall control this chapter is separate and apart from any such easement covenant restriction or other private agreement and the city shall have no obligation or authority to enforce such easement covenant restriction or other private agreement unless the city is a party or beneficiary of the same development  fees a with respect to the provisions applications and permits related to this chapter the governing body may establish by resolution a schedule of fees such schedule may be revised from time to time in the same manner as deemed necessary in the event the schedule of fees indicates that a fee is required for any application permit or other request with regard to any provision or regulation of this chapter such application or request shall not be deemed complete unless accompanied by the requisite fee all such fees shall be made payable to the city and submitted to the city clerk b no fee shall be required for any application filed in the public interest by members of the governing body planning commission board of zoning appeals or city staff development  penalty and enforcement a any violation of any provision contained in this chapter is a public offense and shall be a misdemeanor punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 for each offense or by both such fine and imprisonment for each offense each days violation shall constitute a separate offense b the city shall have the authority to maintain civil suits or actions in any court of competent jurisdiction for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of this chapter and to abate nuisances maintained in violation thereof in the event that any building or structure is or is proposed to be erected constructed altered converted or maintained in violation of this chapter or any building structure or land is proposed to be used in violation of this chapter the city may in addition to any other remedies institute injunction mandamus or other appropriate action or proceeding to prevent such unlawful erection construction reconstruction alteration conversion maintenance or use or to correct or abate such violation or to prevent the occupancy of such building structure or land development  savings clause the repeal of any prior ordinance provisions by the enactment of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived or any subsequent repeal or amendment of any provisions of this chapter shall not affect any violations fines penalties forfeitures or liabilities in effect at such time said provisions repealed are hereby continued in force and effect after the passage approval and publication of this chapter or any subsequent amendment thereof for the purposes of such violations fines penalties forfeitures liabilities and actions therefor and the city shall have the same authority to secure any necessary civil remedies for or prosecution of the same development  severance clause should any section clause or provision of this chapter be held invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction the same shall not affect the validity of this chapter as a whole or any part thereof other than the part so invalid or unconstitutional should any section clause or provision of this chapter be held invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction to a particular building structure or parcel of land such determination shall not affect the application of said section clause or provision to any other building structure or parcel of land unless specifically determined by said court development  secs 15111538  reserved article ii  planning division 1  generally secs 15391564  reserved division 2  planning commission footnotes  2  state law reference planning commission ksa 12744 et seq membership the planning commission shall consist of seven 7 members all of whom shall be residents of the city the members shall be appointed by the mayor and with the consent of the city council the members shall be appointed for terms of three 3 years each  provided that appointments shall be so staggered that no more than three 3 members terms shall expire in any given year vacancies shall be filled by appointment for the unexpired term members may be removed by the mayor by and with the consent of the city council or upon a motion by a member of the city council that is adopted by a twothirds  majority vote of the city council members shall remain in office until their successor takes office development    1 12142015 powers and duties the planning commission shall have the powers granted and duties delegated to it by this chapter and by statute including the making or causing to be made the comprehensive plan and making recommendations on plat approval subdivision regulations site plans zoning regulations and rezonings development  officers  bylaws  and meetings a the planning commission shall elect one 1 member as chairperson and one 1 member as vicechairperson who shall serve one 1 year and until their successors have been elected a secretary also shall be elected who may or may not be a member of the planning commission b the planning commission shall adopt bylaws for the transaction of business and hearing procedures except as otherwise provided in this division all action by the planning commission shall require a quorum of the membership and a majority vote of those present a record of all proceedings of the planning commission shall be kept c the planning commission shall meet regularly at such time and place as it may fix in its bylaws special meetings may be called at any time by the chairperson or in the chairpersons absence by the vicechairperson development  secs 15681592  reserved division 3  comprehensive plan footnotes  3  state law reference comprehensive plan ksa 12747 12748 authorization of comprehensive plan the city planning commission is hereby authorized to make or cause to be made a comprehensive plan for the development and redevelopment of the city the comprehensive plan as amended from time to time shall constitute the basis or guide to ensure a coordinated and harmonious development or redevelopment of the city which will best promote the health safety morals order convenience prosperity and general welfare of the city as well as wise and efficient expenditure of public funds development  plan contents in the preparation of the plan the planning commission shall make or cause to be made comprehensive surveys and studies of past and present conditions and trends relating to land use population and building intensity public facilities transportation and transportation facilities economic conditions natural resources and may include any other element deemed necessary to the comprehensive plan the proposed plan shall show the planning commissions recommendations for the development or redevelopment of the city including 1 the general location extent and relationship of the use of land for agriculture residence business industry recreation education public buildings and other community facilities major utility facilities both public and private and any other use deemed necessary  2 the population and building intensity standards and restrictions and the application of the same  3 public facilities including transportation facilities of all types whether publicly or privately owned which relate to the transportation of persons or goods  4 public improvement programming based upon a determination of relative urgency  5 the major sources and expenditure of public revenue including long range financial plans for the financing of public facilities and capital improvements based upon a projection of the economic and fiscal activity of the community both public and private  6 utilization and conservation of natural resources  and 7 any other element deemed necessary to the proper development or redevelopment of the city development  adoption and amendments a the planning commission may adopt and amend the comprehensive plan as a whole or in parts by a single resolution or by successive resolutions the resolution shall identify specifically any written presentations maps plats charts or other materials made a part of the plan b before adopting or amending any plan or part of a plan the planning commission shall hold a public hearing thereon notice of which shall be published at least once in the official city newspaper at least twenty 20 days prior to the hearing c upon the adoption or amendment of any plan or part of a plan by a majority vote of all members of the planning commission a certified copy of the plan or part together with a written summary of the hearing shall be submitted to the governing body no comprehensive plan shall be effective unless approved by the governing body the governing body may approve such recommendation by ordinance  override the planning commissions recommendations by a twothirds  23  majority vote  or return the plan to the planning commission for further consideration together with a statement specifying the basis for the governing bodys failure to approve or disapprove if the governing body returns the planning commissions recommendations the planning commission after considering the governing bodys statement may resubmit its original recommendations giving the reasons therefore or submit new and amended recommendations upon the receipt of the recommendations the governing body by a simple majority may adopt or may revise or amend and adopt such recommendations by or take no further action thereon if the planning commission fails to deliver its recommendations to the governing body following the planning commissions next regular meeting after receipt of the governing bodys report the governing body shall consider the inaction on the part of the planning commission as a resubmission of the original recommendations and proceed accordingly the comprehensive plan and any amendments thereto shall become effective upon publication of the respective adopting ordinance development  copies to be sent an attested copy of the comprehensive plan and any amendments thereto shall be sent to all other taxing subdivisions in the planning area which request a copy of such plan development  review of plan at least once each year the planning commission shall review or reconsider the plan and may propose amendments extensions or additions to the plan the procedure for the adoption of any amendment extension or addition to any plan or any part of the plan shall be the same as that required for the adoption of the original plan development  public improvements a except as otherwise provided in this chapter whenever the planning commission has adopted and certified a comprehensive plan for one 1 or more major sections or functional subdivisions of the city no public improvement public facility or public utility of a type embraced within the recommendations of the comprehensive plan shall be constructed without first being submitted to and being approved by the planning commission as being in conformity with the plan if the planning commission does not make a report within sixty 60 days the project shall be deemed to have been approved by the planning commission if the planning commission finds that any such proposed public improvement facility or utility does not conform to the plan the commission shall submit in writing to governing body the manner in which such proposed improvement facility or utility does not conform the governing body may override the plan and the report of the planning commission and the plan for the area concerned shall be deemed to have been amended b whenever the planning commission has reviewed a capital improvement program and found that a specific public improvement public facility or public utility of a type embraced within the recommendations of the comprehensive plan is in conformity with the plan no further approval by the planning commission is necessary under this section development  secs 159915124  reserved article iii  land division footnotes  4  state law reference subdivision regulations ksa 12749 et seq division 1  generally secs 1512515146  reserved division 2  plats and platting footnotes  5  state law reference plats ksa 12752 plats and platting a the owner or owners of any land located within the city for the purpose of laying out any subdivisions suburban lots building lots tracts or parcels  or any owner of any land establishing any street alley park or other property intended for public use or for the use of purchasers or owners of lots tracts or parcels of land fronting thereon or adjacent thereto shall have a plat drawn such plat shall accurately describe the subdivision lots tracts or parcels of land giving the location and dimensions thereof and the location and dimensions of all streets alleys parks or other properties intended to be dedicated to public use or for the use of purchasers or owners of lots tracts or parcels of land fronting thereon or adjacent thereto all these lots tracts or parcels shall front upon a public street or an approved private street all plats shall be verified by the owner or owners thereof  and when complete be submitted to the planning commission b plats shall be considered at a public meeting of the planning commission  provided that any plat proposing an exception to the standards in this division shall require a public hearing if a public hearing is required notice of the time place and subject of the hearing shall be published once in the official city newspaper at least twenty 20 days prior to the date fixed for the hearing additionally at least ten 10 days before the hearing the owner shall mail by registered mail return receipt request written notice of the hearing and the nature of the request to all owners of record of real property located within two hundred feet 200 of the affected land when the notice has been properly addressed and deposited in the mail failure of a party to receive that notice shall not invalidate any subsequent action taken by the planning commission or the governing body c the planning commission may approve the plat if it finds that the following criteria are satisfied 1 the plat satisfies the requirements of this chapter the applicable zoning district regulations and any other applicable provisions of the city subject only to acceptable rule exceptions 2 the subdivision represents an overall development pattern that is consistent with the comprehensive plan and the official street map 3 the plat contains a sound wellconceived parcels and land subdivision layout that is consistent with good land planning and site engineering design principles 4 the arrangement character width and locations of all lots and streets on the plat shall be considered in their relation to existing lots and streets to reasonable traffic circulation to topographic conditions to runoff and stormwater to public convenience and safety and to public services and utilities 5 no single family lot shall have less width depth or area than is set out in the appropriate lot size regulations for district r1 except as may be approved in the planned zoning process of division 2 subdivision iii 6 all lots whether by subdivision plat lot split or lot merger shall be as near rectangular as is practical due consideration being given to lots fronting on curved streets and culdesac turnarounds lot lines shall generally be at right angles to abutting streets and radial to curved streets and culdesac turnarounds vehicular access to residential lots from arterial streets is discouraged and will be permitted only when other access is not available all lots shall have the full lot width exposed to a public or private street 7 all submission requirements have been satisfied d if this determination is not made within sixty 60 days after the first meeting of the planning commission following the date of the submission of the plat to the planning commission the plat shall be deemed to have been approved and a certificate so verifying shall be issued by the secretary of the planning commission upon demand if the planning commission finds that the plat does not conform to the requirements of this the planning commission shall notify the owner or owners of that fact if the plat conforms to the requirements of the regulations there shall be endorsed on the plat the fact that the plat has been submitted to and approved by the planning commission e the governing body shall accept or refuse the dedication of land for public purposes within thirty 30 days after the first meeting of the governing body following the date of the submission of the plat to the planning commission the governing body may defer action for an additional thirty 30 days for the purpose of allowing for modifications to comply with the requirements established by the governing body no additional filing fees shall be assessed during that period if the governing body defers or refuses that dedication it shall advise the planning commission of the reasons thereof f any replatting of any existing plat shall follow and be subject to the requirements and procedures herein for a plat g the governing body may establish a scale of reasonable fees to be paid by the applicant for the review of each plat or replat filed with the planning commission h no building or zoning permit shall be issued for the use or construction of any structure upon any lot tract or parcel of land located within the city that has been subdivided or replatted after the date of this as may be amended unless the plat has been approved in the manner provided herein i the register of deeds shall not file any plat or replat until it bears the endorsement of the planning commission and the land dedicated for public purposes has been accepted by the governing body development    8222013   1 1282014 vesting of development rights a for the purpose of singlefamily residential developments development rights in such land use shall vest upon recording of a plat or replat of such land if construction is not commenced on such land within five 5 years of recording the development rights in such shall expire b for all purposes other than singlefamily developments the right to use land for a particular purpose shall vest upon the issuance of all permits required for such use by the city and construction has begun and substantial amounts of work have been completed under a validly issued permit development  lot splits a a platted lot may be divided into not more than two 2 lots without having to replat the original lot  provided that the resulting lots shall not again be divided without replatting all resulting lots must meet all minimum standards of this chapter and any other applicable city codes and must make provisions for any needed rightofway easements and improvement of public facilities furthermore all resulting lots must meet the greater of the minimum front lot width and minimum square area requirements of the applicable zoning district or the average front lot width and square area of all similarly zoned lots within two hundred feet 200 of either resulting lot b an exception to this requirement may be made by the planning commission for a proposed corner lot  provided the proposed corner lot meets the minimum zoning district requirements and it is determined that the proposed corner lot will not have a dramatic impact upon the character of the surrounding neighborhood c applications for a lot split will be referred to the planning commission all costs resulting from any such application shall be born by the applicant the application shall include a survey of the proposed lots and improvements certified by a registered engineer or surveyor in order to evidence that the details contained on the survey are true and accurate the survey shall contain the following information 1 the dimension and location of each lot including a metes and bounds description  2 the location and character of all proposed and existing easements and public and private utility lines including sewers storm and sanitary water gas telecommunications cable and power lines  3 building setback lines with dimensions  4 the location of proposed or existing streets and driveways providing access to said lots  5 physical property survey including typography with contour intervals not more than five feet 5 and including the location of watercourses ravines existing significant trees permanent structures and proposed drainage structures  and 6 any other information deemed necessary by the planning commission d no building or zoning permit shall be issued for a lot produced by nonplatted lot split until such lot split has been approved in the manner provided in this section any structure existing at the time of the lot split must continue to comply with this division and any other applicable city code development  lot mergers a unless otherwise approved and provided for by this chapter no construction of any structure shall be allowed across existing property or exterior lot lines no building permit shall be issued for construction on any property or lot that has been merged whether by common ownership deed or administrative action without complying with the requirements of this article multiple lots may be replatted in accordance with the provisions of this article and any other applicable city regulation b no applications for a lot merger on residential lots shall be approved that would result in the following situations 1 lot mergers resulting in double frontage lots for purposes of this section double frontage shall mean a property having frontage on two 2 or more intersecting parallel or nearly parallel streets 2 lot mergers resulting in a merged lot being separated or bisected by a public street 3 lot mergers resulting in the new lot width being fifty percent 50% larger than the average lot width of the properties within two hundred feet 200 of the proposed lot merger 4 lot mergers resulting in the total square footage of the new lot being fifty percent 50% larger than the average square footage of the properties within two hundred feet 200 of the proposed lot merger for purposes of calculating the percentages of subsections b3 and 4 above the lots that are the subject of the application for lot merger and the largest and smallest lots within the two hundred feet 200 area shall not be considered c exception the planning commission may grant an exception to subsections 3 and 4 above where 1 the resulting merged lot is one hundred thirty feet 130 wide or less  2 the resulting merged lot is less than eighteen thousand 18000 square feet  3 the resulting lot and application of the development standards to the lot will not have an adverse impact on the character of the surrounding neighborhood and in particular the intent statements of the r1 site design standards  and 4 the resulting lot and application of development standards to the lot will not have an adverse impact on the property owners within two hundred feet 200 of the proposed merged lot development    8222013   3 1282014 secs 1515115168  reserved division 3  temporary uses and permits statement of intent certain uses of land or buildings are not appropriate on a permanent basis but may be appropriate or acceptable on a temporary basis where adequate precautions are taken to ensure the temporary nature of the use in order to limit any detrimental impact of the use upon the use and enjoyment of neighboring properties as further provided for by the specific provisions of this division these allowed temporary uses may be authorized the approval of a temporary use permit or by general regulations establishing and regulating the time place and manner in which the temporary use will be allowed hereafter temporary use development    portable storage units a allowed temporary use  a single portable storage unit may be temporarily placed without a permit upon any real property within the city for a time period not to exceed thirty 30 days no more than two 2 times per calendar year if a person or entity seeks additional time or frequency for such use upon showing of good cause the building officialcodes administrator is hereby authorized to extend this time period up to an additional thirty 30 days for a maximum time period of sixty 60 days or to increase the allowed frequency to three 3 times per calendar year in addition upon showing of good cause the planning commission is hereby authorized to extend the time period up to a maximum time period of six 6 months to increase the allowed frequency to up to four 4 times per calendar year or to permit a second portable storage unit upon the real property at any one 1 time  provided the planning commission may establish any reasonable conditions upon any such approval the city may establish a fee approved by the governing body for any such authorization by either the building officialcodes administrator or the planning commission b with building permit  1 notwithstanding the time restrictions set forth in a of this section when used in conjunction with a building permit a permittee can temporarily place a single portable storage unit upon the real property subject to the building permit for the duration of the initial building permit period plus ten 10 days before and ten 10 days after the building permit period  provided however the building officialcodes administrator has the discretion to shorten or otherwise limit this time period for a portable storage unit based upon his evaluation of the scope of the permitted project the building officialcodes administrator may also exercise this discretion when work on the permitted project is no longer active and ongoing or because the use of the portable storage unit no longer appears to be necessary for the ongoing activities of the permitted project  provided that in such event the permittee shall first be allowed a reasonable opportunity to provide any evidence or explanation to the contrary 2 in the event the building permit period is extended by the building officialcodes administrator or the governing body as provided for by the building provisions of of this chapter the building officialcodes administrator or when applicable the governing body shall have the discretion to extend the time period for the portable storage unit for some or all of the extension period for the building permit  provided that the building officialcodes administrator or when applicable the governing body may establish any reasonable conditions upon any such extension c additional requirements  any allowed portable storage unit is subject to the following 1 must be maintained in a safe and clean manner and in good condition and repair 2 must be placed on a concrete or asphalt surface  provided that the building officialcodes administrator may waive this requirement for good cause shown 3 cannot be placed in the rightofway in a manner blocking any sidewalk fire department access or the lineofsight of traffic or in any other manner creating any peril or danger to persons or property 4 may only be used to store nonhazardous personal property that is directly related to or accessory to the use of the real property upon which the portable storage unit is placed or to the occupants or owners therein and may not be used to store the personal property of any other person or entity who is not an owner or occupant of said real property 5 when on any residential property on which a singlefamily dwelling or duplex has been or is being constructed the portable storage unit must be placed in front of the dwelling or duplex but no closer than ten feet 10 from the front property line  provided the building officialcodes administrator may waive this requirement for good cause shown 6 cannot contain any commercial personal property or be used for any commercial purpose except to the extent used by a contractor in conjunction with any allowed construction or remodeling on or related to said property development    temporary dumpsters a allowed temporary use  a single dumpster may be temporarily placed without a permit upon any real property within the city for a time period not to exceed thirty 30 days no more than two 2 times per calendar year if a person or entity seeks additional time or frequency for such use upon showing of good cause the building officialcodes administrator is hereby authorized to extend this time period up to an additional thirty 30 days for a maximum time period of sixty 60 days or to increase the allowed frequency to three 3 times per calendar year in addition upon showing of good cause the planning commission is hereby authorized to extend the time period up to a maximum time period of six 6 months to increase the allowed frequency to up to four 4 times per calendar year or to permit a second dumpster upon the real property at any one 1 time  provided that the planning commission may establish any reasonable conditions upon any such approval the city may establish a fee approved by the governing body for any such authorization by either the building officialcodes administrator or the planning commission b with building permit  1 notwithstanding the time restrictions set forth in a of this section when used in conjunction with a building permit a permittee can temporarily place a single dumpster upon the real property subject to the building permit for the duration of the initial building permit period plus ten 10 days before and ten 10 days after the building permit period  provided however that the building officialcodes administrator has the discretion to shorten or otherwise limit this time period for a dumpster based upon his evaluation of the scope of the permitted project the building officialcodes administrator may also exercise this discretion when work on the permitted project is no longer active and ongoing or because the use of the dumpster no longer appears to be necessary for the ongoing activities of the permitted project  provided that in such event the permittee shall first be allowed a reasonable opportunity to provide any evidence or explanation to the contrary 2 in the event the building permit period is extended by the building officialcodes administrator or the governing body as provided for by the building provisions of of this chapter the building officialcodes administrator or when applicable the governing body shall have the discretion to extend the time period for the dumpster for some or all of the extension period for the building permit  provided that the building officialcodes administrator or when applicable the governing body may establish any reasonable conditions upon any such extension c additional restrictions  any allowed dumpster is subject to the following 1 must be maintained in a safe and clean manner and in good condition and repair 2 must be placed on a concrete or asphalt surface  provided that the building officialcodes administrator may waive this requirement for good cause shown 3 cannot be placed in the rightofway in a manner blocking any sidewalk fire department access or the lineofsight of traffic or in any other manner creating any peril or danger to persons or property 4 may only be used to store nonhazardous personal property that is directly related to or accessory to the use of the real property upon which the dumpster is placed or to the occupants or owners therein and may not be used to store the personal property of any other person or entity who is not an owner or occupant of said real property 5 when on any residential property on which a singlefamily dwelling or duplex has been or is being constructed the dumpster must be placed in front of the dwelling or duplex but no closer than ten feet 10 from the front property line  provided that the building officialcodes administrator may waive this requirement for good cause shown 6 cannot contain any commercial personal property or be used for any commercial purpose except to the extent used by a contractor in conjunction with any allowed construction or remodeling on or related to said property d exemptions  any dumpster that is not used on a temporary basis but is instead approved by the governing body for ongoing use in accordance with applicable to permanent or longterm dumpsters on public institutional or commercial real property or on any residential property with a dwelling or dwellings of four 4 units or more shall be exempt from the provisions of this section development    violations and abatement a notice of violation  if the building officialcodes administrator determines that a temporary use is being maintained in violation of any applicable section or subsection of this division or of any other city ordinance notice shall be given to the property owner or his agent to remove or to otherwise bring the temporary use into proper compliance such notice shall include 1 a description of the real property sufficient for identification  2 a statement of the violation and why the notice is being issued  3 a correction order allowing a reasonable time to remove or bring the temporary use into proper compliance  4 a statement of the property owners right to appeal the notice and order within five 5 days after notice was served  5 a statement that the failure to comply shall result in the citys right to abate the temporary use at the owners expense and that failure to thereafter pay the assessment within thirty 30 days of the notice of costs shall result in the filing of a tax lien against the property or the filing for judgment against the recipient or both  and 6 a statement that the violation is subject to prosecution provided that the city may immediately take any action as is reasonably necessary to abate the temporary use without notice and at the owners expense when it is placed in the rightofway public park or other public property without city authorization  in a manner blocking any sidewalk fire department access or the lineofsight of traffic  or in any other manner creating any peril or danger to persons or property b abatement  if the property owner or agent fails to take appropriate action in response to the notice of violation then the city may take any action as is reasonably necessary to abate the violation at the owners expense in doing so neither the city nor its agent shall be responsible for damage to property due to reasonable methods of gaining entrance onto the property or for damages to property in the reasonable exercise of the abatement of the violation the city may use the citys employees or contract for such services c notice and collection of costs  if the city takes action to abate the violation the city shall give to the owner or agent a notice of costs providing 1 a description of the real property sufficient for identification  2 the nature of the violation  3 the nature of the work performed to abate the violation  4 the abatement costs incurred  5 a demand for payment within thirty 30 days from the date of notice  6 a statement that the failure to pay within thirty 30 days shall allow the city to file a tax lien against the property andor to pursue litigation for the recovery of costs  and 7 a statement that any interest and any city costs necessary to recover any amounts due including court costs attorneys fees and administrative costs shall be added to the outstanding balance due included as part of the abatement costs incurred are the costs for city staff time and expenses postage and any necessary court costs and attorneys fees if unpaid after thirty 30 days of service of the notice of costs these amounts shall be assessed as a special assessment against the property and the city clerk shall at the time of certifying other city taxes certify the unpaid portion of these costs and the county clerk shall extend the same on the tax rolls of the county against the lot or parcel of ground and it shall be collected by the county treasurer and paid to the city as other city taxes are collected and paid assessments made under this section shall be superior to all liens except general tax liens provided further that the city may collect such costs in the manner provided at ksa 121115 by bringing an action in the appropriate court as a personal debt and the city may pursue both assessment and collection at the same time until the full cost including applicable interest court costs and administrative costs have been paid in full d service of notices  the notice of violation and the notice of costs shall be deemed to be properly served if a written copy thereof is delivered personally  sent by certified or firstclass mail addressed to the last known address  or if the notice is returned showing that the letter was not delivered a copy thereof shall be posted in a conspicuous place in or about the structure affected by such notice development    no limitation of action nothing within the provisions of this division concerning temporary uses and permits shall be construed to be a waiver or shall otherwise prevent the city from exercising any applicable legal or equitable right or authority or from taking any appropriate action under any other applicable statute ordinance policy or other regulatory power including but not limited to the citys nuisance ordinance codified as of this amendments thereto or the citys building code provisions codified as of this chapter and amendments thereto development    secs 1517415199  reserved division 4  utility facilities in general a applicability  this division shall apply to all facilities located within the city b purpose  by virtue of its police powers the city hereby establishes the following regulations on the placement and maintenance of facilities for the health safety and welfare of its citizens in order to 1 protect the public from hazards associated with facilities including but not limited to damages injuries and service outages due to vehicle accidents inclement weather adjacent property maintenance and other causes  2 improve and ensure the operational safety and integrity of city streets  3 minimize disruption to the city and the public  4 maintain or improve city aesthetics and protect the environmental landscape  and 5 recognize protect and address issues related to incumbent facility users while encouraging competition on an equitable basis c administration  the public works director is the principal city official responsible for the administration of this division and may delegate any or all of the duties therefor development  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning aerial facilities means facilities located primarily above grade on poles and includes the poles pole supports foundations attached wires cable and other facilities and any appurtenances thereto city row ordinance means the ordinance adopted for managing the use and excavation of the public rightofway codified at as amended constructconstruction means to install erect build attach or place any facility emergency means a condition that poses a clear and immediate danger to life or health or of a significant loss of property  or requires immediate repair or replacement in order to restore service to a user facilityfacilities means all lines pipes wires cables fiber conduit including inner ducts poles utility structures appliances antennae transmitters gates meters or other equipment or appurtenances used for the transmission or distribution of utility services facility user means any person or entity owning leasing or operating facilities within the city public improvement means any project undertaken by the city for the construction reconstruction maintenance or repair of any public infrastructure and including without limitation streets alleys bridges bikeways parkways sidewalks sewers drainage facilities traffic control devices street lights public facilities public buildings or public lands rightofway means the area on below or above streets alleys bridges and parkways utility easement means any public or private easement dedicated for the placement of facilities over on or underground utility structure means aboveground facilities other than aerial facilities and towers that are cabinets boxes vaults pedestals buildings or other structures and equipment or appurtenances thereto necessary for the operation of utility service including the supports and foundations condensing units and generators for the same development  location of facilitiesgenerally a in general  facilities shall be permitted in any zoning district but must be constructed within the rightofway or within a utility easement except for drop lines to residences and businesses unless the facility user owns the real property in fee as appropriate and provided for herein facilities may be constructed within setbacks this provision shall not be construed to exempt a facility user from any other applicable ordinances authorizations regulations or other requirements of the city including but not limited to a franchise other zoning regulations or building codes b existing facilities  except as provided for in this division facilities in existence as of the effective date of the ordinance from which this division is derived that have been properly maintained and meet any and all applicable technical or safety requirement are permitted in their current configuration without further requirement of screening or change said facilities may be replaced with similar facilities of comparable or lesser size  provided that any relocation or extensions of aboveground facilities shall abide by the requirements for new facilities hereafter c new facilities  any new facilities including the relocation or extension of existing aboveground facilities shall be 1 placed underground unless otherwise specifically provided for in this division  and 2 placed at a location that will not block or unduly interfere with the passage or placement of public improvements or facilities by other existing or potential facility users as reasonably determined by the public works director the facility user shall also consider any request made by the city concerning placement of facilities in utility easements in order to limit or eliminate future public improvement relocation expenses d noninterference and protection of facilities  facility users shall construct operate repair and maintain their facilities so as to reasonably minimize interference with the rights and reasonable convenience of the public and any property owners it shall be the responsibility of the facility user to take adequate measures to protect and defend its facilities from harm and damage e exclusion of certain locations  the public works director may in his reasonable discretion designate certain locations to be excluded from location of additional facilities including but not limited to historical or scenic locations or where additional facilities location is deemed unsuitable due to engineering technological proprietary legal public health safety or welfare concerns  provided that such discretion shall be in accordance with any applicable statutory provisions the city will cooperate in good faith with the facility user to attempt to find suitable alternative location  provided the city shall not be required to incur financial cost or to acquire new locations for a facility user development  sameunderground facilities a accessibility to underground facilities  any facility user placing facilities in subsurface conduits pipes or such other suitable and acceptable method or type of underground installation meeting any and all existing technical and safety standards shall subject to any applicable requirements herein have the right to place such necessary manholes and appliances for affording access to such facilities and making connections therefrom to subscribers and stations b depth requirement  a minimum depth of fortyeight inches 48 shall be maintained from the street surface to the top of any boring no facilities shall be installed less than fortyeight inches 48 below the street surface of any rightofway the minimum depth for any facilities installed underground outside the street surface is twentyfour inches 24  provided that underground telecommunications or cable drop lines are exempt from this requirement but shall be buried at a reasonably safe depth any facilities installed less than fortyeight inches 48 under the street surface or twentyfour inches 24 outside of the street surface is done so at the risk of the facility user and the city shall not be responsible for any damage to the same these minimum depth requirements are not intended to supersede any building code depth requirement greater than the minimums prescribed in this section development  sameutility structures utility structures may be installed only where alternative underground facilities are not reasonably feasible taking into account industry practices costs technological considerations and other relevant factors utility structures shall be subject to the following requirements 1 required approval for small utility structures  utility structures with a footprint of twelve 12 square feet or less a pad of fifteen 15 square feet or less and a height of four and onehalf feet 412 or less may be permitted upon approval by the public works director provided a utility structure located within a utility easement behind the established building line with a footprint of one and onehalf 112 square feet or less a paid of two 2 square feet or less and a height of three feet 3 or less shall be subject to the requirements of this division but shall not require any specific city approval or permit 2 required approval for large utility structures  utility structures with a footprint of greater than twelve 12 square feet a pad greater than fifteen 15 square feet or a height greater than four and onehalf feet 412 may be permitted upon approval of a special use permit by the governing body which may be limited by any appropriate conditions or term established by the governing body the special use permit may only be issued by the governing body after notification of adjacent and abutting property owners  a public hearing  and recommendation of the planning commission consideration of the special use shall be in accordance with established need for the proposed facilities at the proposed location  design lighting landscaping screening and noise of the proposed facilities  suitable location providing for minimal if any interference with adjacent properties  affect on surrounding property values  and impact on the health safety and welfare of surrounding properties the impact of the proposed facilities on nearby or adjacent properties especially residential properties shall be carefully considered the design lighting landscaping screening and noise of the proposed facilities shall be considered with the intent to impose the least amount of impact on nearby or adjacent properties while large utility structures may be permitted in any zoning district the city preference is for such structures to be located in existing business districts 3 location  within residential districts utility structures shall be placed in the rear yard wherever practical if as determined by the public works director rear yard locating is not practical or appropriate then the facility user will work with city staff to determine a pad size and location that is most appropriate and compatible with adjacent uses including adjacent property owners uses within all districts utility structures located within the rightofway shall be placed behind the sidewalk and are subject to approval by the public works director 4 landscaping and screening  any utility structure larger than a footprint of one and onehalf 112 square feet a pad of two 2 square feet or a height of three feet 3 that is located within the rightofway or between the rightofway and the established building line shall be substantially screened from public view any large utility structure in any location shall be substantially screened from public view where landscaping is used for screening a landscape plan shall be submitted with an application for a building permit the landscape plan is subject to approval by the city in their discretion either the public works director or the planning commission may require the landscape plan to be sealed by a landscape architect registered in the state the expense and maintenance of all screening and landscaping shall be the responsibility of the facility user unless written acceptance of such responsibility is provided from the property owner or homes association the responsibility of the facility user for maintaining screening that consists of landscaping shall only extend for twelve 12 months from the date such landscaping is planted after which time such landscaping shall be considered part of the natural habitat of the surrounding environs 5 noise  the utility structure shall not emit any unnecessary intrusive noise development  sameaerial facilities a new and replacement aerial facilities  no facility user shall 1 construct new aerial facilities 2 install a replacement pole that increases the diameter of the existing pole by more than twelve inches 12  adds more than one 1 additional cross bar or brackets  or is taller than forty feet 40 as measured from ground level to the tip of any facility on the pole  provided that an existing pole taller than forty feet 40 may be replaced with a pole of equal or lesser height  and further provided upon a showing of good cause the public works director may extend this height requirement to fortyfive feet 45 no cross bar or bracket shall exceed the current size any replacement pole shall be of like material to the existing pole b existing aerial facilities  1 in the event a current pole owner decides to relocate its aerial facilities underground all other facility users using such pole shall also relocate their aerial facilities at such time  provided that this requirement shall not apply if only drop lines are being relocated 2 where reasonable and appropriate aerial facility users shall place aerial facilities underground when required to relocate said facilities in conjunction with public improvement projects 3 nothing in this division shall be construed as prohibiting necessary repairs to any existing aerial facilities properly in use within the city c drop lines  new drop lines to residences and businesses shall be constructed underground  provided that aerial drop lines connecting to aerial facilities may be allowed when other utilities have already legally utilized aerial drop lines or when otherwise authorized by the public works director development  sameexception emergency or unusual circumstances a in recognition of the inherent danger thereof high voltage electrical transmission lines shall be exempt from the requirements of this division regarding placing facilities underground and pole height restrictions instead all high voltage electrical transmission lines constructed within the city shall be placed on a casebycase basis with prior siting approval by the city council upon the planning commissions recommendation b notwithstanding the provisions of this division the public works director may grant special permission on a temporary basis not to exceed six 6 months for an exception to the requirements of this division on such terms as the public works director may deem appropriate in cases of emergency unusual circumstances physical impracticality or impossibility extreme economic hardship or lack of existing technology without discrimination as to the person or entity to construct maintain use or operate facilities c notwithstanding the provisions of this division the city council upon the planning commissions recommendation may grant special permission on a permanent basis for an exception to the requirements of this division on such terms as the city council may deem appropriate in cases of emergency unusual circumstances physical impracticality or impossibility extreme economic hardship or lack of existing technology without discrimination as to the person or entity to construct maintain use or operate facilities d if there is an emergency necessitating response work or repair a facility user may begin that repair or emergency response work or take any action required under the circumstances provided that the facility user notifies the city promptly after beginning the work and timely thereafter meets any permit or other requirement had there not been such an emergency development  construction requirements all facilities shall be constructed and maintained to a suitable degree of safety and appearance as established in this chapter and by any other applicable code statute ordinance law regulation or standard including all technical standards governing construction reconstruction installation operation testing use maintenance and dismantling of such facilities promulgated by national trade associations commonly associated with the service provided by the facility user facilities not properly constructed or maintained will be considered a nuisance and will be either timely upgraded or removed at the facility users expense development  requirements on work in utility easements a facility user constructing repairing replacing or maintaining facilities in a utility easement must comply with any applicable zoning or building code requirements if working in a utility easement on
