development    1 12142015 appendix a  charter ordinances charter ordinance no 1 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of of the general statutes of 196 relating to the election and appointment of city officers and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject repealed by charter ordinance no 4 passed  charter ordinance no 2 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of the general statutes of 194 14205 relating to the filling of vacancies on the city council provisions of charter ordinance no 2 abrogated by repeal of ksa 14801 and passage of ksa 124101 et seq l of 197 ch 61 charter ordinance no 3 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from of the general statutes of kansas 194 and providing substitute provisions on the same subject relating to the appointment of a police judge protem provisions of charter ordinance no 3 abrogated by repeal of ksa 14801 and passage of ksa 124101 et seq l of 197 ch 61 charter ordinance no 4 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 1967 supp 14201 relating to the election and appointment of city officers and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject repealed by charter ordinance no 5 passed jan 6 1969 charter ordinance no 5 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of sections 7 8 and 32 chapter 274 laws of kansas 196 relating to the election and appointment of city offices and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject repealed by charter ordinance no 7 passed  charter ordinance no 6 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from ksa 791952  providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject and removing certain limitations of tax levy be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas a city of the second class by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself from and make inapplicable to it ksa 791952 and provide substitute and additional provisions as hereinafter set forth in this ordinance ksa 791952 is applicable to this city but is not applicable uniformly to all cities of the second class and the legislature has not established classes of cities for the purpose of imposing tax limitations and prohibitions under said constitutional provisions the governing body of the city of fairway kansas is hereby authorized and empowered to levy taxes in each year on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation of said city for the following city purposes  provided that the city purposes specifically authorized by other statutes are not excluded because they are not enumerated herein general operating fund which shall include the following activities general government police department fire department  health and sanitation including refuse collection and disposal  highways all public traveled ways including bridges  storm sewer maintenance  parks  street lighting  restrooms  hydrant rental  forestry  military memorial maintenance  civil defense  recreation  flood control and community buildings said governing body may levy an amount necessary to meet the requirements of its adopted budget passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof the 6th day of october 1969 charter ordinance no 7 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 1969 supp 14201 sections 7 8 and 32 chapter 274 laws of kansas 1968 and the last paragraph of ksa 1969 supp 14103 chapter 274 laws of kansas 1968 relating to the election and appointment of city offices and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas under the authority of of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself from and make inapplicable to it ksa 1969 supp 14201  laws of kansas 1968 and the last paragraph of ksa 1969 supp 14103 laws of kansas 1968 which applies to said city but the provisions of which do not apply uniformly to all cities and provides substitute and additional provisions on the same subject there shall be elected on the first tuesday in april of each odd numbered year one councilman from each of the four wards in the city as hereinafter provided there shall be an elected mayor every four years beginning on the first tuesday in april 1969 the mayor shall appoint by and with the consent of the council the city treasurer a municipal judge of the municipal court a city marshalchief of police city clerk city attorney and may appoint policeman and such other officers as they may deem necessary officers so appointed and confirmed shall hold their offices for a term of one year and until their successors are appointed and qualified the council shall by ordinance specify their duties and compensation and by ordinance may abolish any office created by them whenever they may deem it expedient the council may retain a licensed professional engineer to act in the capacity of the city engineer for specifically defined duties and provide for reasonable compensation for the services rendered the mayor and councilmen shall hold their offices for a term of four years councilmen elected in april of 1967 shall have terms expiring in 1969 councilmen elected in april of 1968 shall have terms expiring in 197 except for the one councilman in ward 2 who was elected only for an unexpired term for one year until the april 1969 election there shall be no primary elections for city officers the general election of city officers shall be held on the first tuesday in april of each oddnumbered year commencing with the 1969 election and the fouryear terms of city officers shall begin with those elected in 1969 charter ordinance no 5 and and 4102 revised ordinance of the city of fairway kansas 196 are hereby repealed passed by the governing body by not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 3rd day of august 1970 charter ordinance no 8 an ordinance levying and imposing taxes or fees upon and for the privilege of engaging in any business trade occupation or profession or rendering or furnishing any service for profit or livelihood in the city of fairway kansas to provide revenue to defray a part of the expenses of said city  defining terms used in the ordinance  prescribing licensing and administrative procedure and penalties repealed by charter ordinance no 9 charter ordinance no 9 a charter ordinance repealing charter ordinance no 8 of the city of fairway kansas relating to the levying and imposing taxes or fees upon and for the privilege or engaging in any business trade occupation or profession or rendering or furnishing any service for profit in the city of fairway kansas be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas under the authority of subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby repeals charter passed by the governing body by not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 2nd day of september 1975 charter ordinance no 10 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 124112 and repealing of article 1 of chapter viii of the codified ordinances of the city of fairway kansas prohibiting the assessment of court costs and providing authorization for the assessment of such costs and providing authorization for the assessment of such costs be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas under the authority of of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself from and make inapplicable to it ksa 124112 which applies to said city but the provisions of which do not apply uniformly to all cities and provide substitute and additional provisions on the same subject the city of fairway kansas does hereby repeal of of of the codified ordinances of the city of fairway kansas prohibiting the assessment of court costs any person found guilty of violating the ordinances of the city of fairway kansas by the municipal judge or judge pro tempore may be assessed court costs including but not limited to court reporter or stenographic charges fees and mileage of witnesses expenses incurred in the service of process costs of publication of notices and such other charges as are authorized by the statutes of the state of kansas passed by the governing body by not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 5th day of march 1979 charter ordinance no 11 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from ksa 795001 to 795017 inclusive and any amendments thereto repealed by ordinance no 933 passed  charter ordinance no 12 a charter ordinance providing for the collection of recyclable products and for the assessment of service fees in the city of fairway kansas be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas a city of the second class by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby provides for the collection of recyclable products and for the assessment of fees collection of recyclable products the city shall provide for and regulate the collection of recyclable products from all residences in the city the city may provide for the collection service contracting with a person firm corporation homes association county another city or any combination thereof for the benefit of the entire city or portions thereof as deemed to be in t the best interest of the city and its inhabitants rules and regulations rules and regulations pertaining to collecting and transporting recyclable products in the city shall be as follows a any person engaging in the business of collecting or transporting recyclable products within the corporate limits of the city shall first obtain a permit therefore from the city each applicant for any such permit shall state in hisher application the following 1 the characteristics of the recyclable products to be collected and transported  2 the number of recyclable product vehicles and equipment to be operated thereunder  3 the precise location or locations of recyclable product collection  4 the boundaries of the collection area  5 the dates andor frequency of the collection  6 the amount of the proposed fee to be charged b before a permit shall be issued by the city the applicant must furnish the city a certificate of insurance showing a minimum public liability insurance coverage of at least two hundred fifty thousand dollars $25000000 for each person injured or killed in amount of not less than five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 in the event of injury or death of two or more persons in any single accident and in an amount of not less than two hundred thousand dollars $20000000 for damage to property in the event the insurance is canceled during the term of the permit the insurance carrier shall notify the city in writing no less than 10 days prior to the effective date of such cancellation the certificate of insurance shall provide that the insurance company agrees to so notify the city and further the insurance policy shall contain a written provision that shall place the responsibility for the ten 10 day written notice upon the company issuing the policy in order that coverage be considered proper c the governing body may define and promulgate reasonable and necessary rules and regulations governing recyclable product management system which rules and regulations shall be filed in the office of the city clerk of the city assessment and collection of fees the city shall assess collection fee for each dwelling unit as hereinbefore provided and city clerk shall at the time of certifying city taxes certify the amount thereof and the county clerk shall extend the same on the tax rolls of the county against the real property passed by the governing body by not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 2nd day of july 1990 charter ordinance no 13 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 124203 and ksa 124207 relating to the issuance and service of warrants and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas under the authority of of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself from and make inapplicable to it ksa 124203 and ksa 124207 which apply to said city but the provisions of which do not apply uniformly to all cities and provides substitute and additional provisions on the same subject in addition to the authority of the city attorney municipal judge and law enforcement officers of the city of fairway kansas as specifically provided by ksa 124203 and ksa 124207 authority to issue warrants and service notice to appear before the municipal court of the city of fairway kansas is hereby extended to the following officers of the city of fairway kansas subject to the limitations herein provided the prosecuting attorney or any prosecuting attorney pro tem of the city of fairway kansas is hereby granted the same authority to issue or refuse to issue warrants as is conferred upon the city attorney by the provisions of ksa 124203 the following officers are hereby authorized to issue a complaint or warrant for the violation of the city ordinances as hereinafter provided to be served upon the accused person by the officer authorized to issue such warrant or complaint or in accordance with the service provisions of ksa 124207 a the city clerk is authorized to issue and serve a warrant for violations of entitled health sanitation and welfare entitled sewer regulations entitled streets sidewalks fences and walls and entitled zoning and planning for the city ordinances of the city of fairway kansas b the duly appointed animal control officer is authorized to issue and serve complaints and warrants for violations of entitled animals and fowls for the city ordinances of fairway kansas c the public officer of the city of fairway kansas is authorized to issue and serve warrants and complaints for violation of the provisions of entitled unfit structures of entitled health sanitation and welfare of the city of ordinances of the city of fairway kansas nothing herein shall be construed to modify or restrict the authority of the city officers of fairway kansas conferred by the provisions of ksa 124203 and ksa 124207 passed by the governing body by not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 5th day of november 1990 charter ordinance no 14 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of the ksa 14205 relating to the qualifications of the officers appointment of nonresidents  removal of officer effect oaths and bonds repealed by charter ordinance no 16 passed  charter ordinance no 15 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from ksa 124207 providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject relating to service of uniform notices to appear and complaints filed with the fairway municipal court the city of fairway kansas by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to make inapplicable to it and exempts itself from ksa 124207 relating to service of the complaints filed in the municipal court which applies to said city by no uniformly to all cities and provides substitute and additional provisions on this same subject as herein provided complaints and notices to appear  service complaints and notices to appear shall be served upon the accused persons by delivering a copy to him or her personally or by leaving it at the dwelling house of the accused person or usual place of abode with some person of suitable age and discretion then residing therein or by mailing it to the last known address of said person a complaint and notice to appear may be served by a law enforcement officer fire marshal or duly appointed fairway city building official code enforcement officer or zoning enforcement officer animal control officer or public service officer with the state and if mailed shall be mailed by a fairway law enforcement officer of the clerk of the municipal court no provisions of this charter be construed to empower fire marshals building officials code enforcement officers zoning enforcement officers animal control officers public service officer or court clerks with powers of arrest search detention or other powers of law enforcement officers except as provided by law upon service by mail the law enforcement officer or court clerk shall execute a verification to be filed with a copy of the notice to appear said verification shall be deemed sufficient if in substantially the following form the undersigned hereby certifies that on the _____ day of ________ 19_____ a copy of the complaint and notice to appear was mailed to ______________ at ______________ signature of law enforcement officer or court clerk publication this charter be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper effective date this charter take effect sixty 60 days after its final publication passed by twothirds  23  vote of the city council this 5th day of january 1998 charter ordinance no 16 a charter ordinance amending charter ordinance number 14 exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 14205 relating to the qualifications of the officers appointment of nonresidents  removal of officers effect oaths and bonds repealed by charter ordinance no 17 passed  charter ordinance no 17 a charter ordinance amending and repealing charter ordinance number 16 exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 14205 relating to the qualifications of officers appointment of nonresidents  removal of officers effect oaths and bonds be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas by the power vested in it by of the kansas constitution hereby elects to and does amend existing of charter add supplemental provisions on the same subject of charter is hereby amended to read as follows all officers of the city of fairway kansas elected or appointed shall be residents of the state of kansas or missouri if any such officer shall change residence and no longer reside in either the state of kansas or of missouri a vacancy shall be created in such office the clerk shall enter every appointment to office and the date thereof on the journal of the proceedings the city council may require all city officers elected or appointed to take and subscribe an oath and give bonds and security for the faithful performance of their duties this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the kansas constitution in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereof passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 14 th day of april 2003 charter ordinance no 18 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of the water pollution control act ksa 123101 through ksa 123107 and providing substitute and additional provisions relating to the establishment operation maintenance improvement and regulation of sewer systems including but not limited to storm and surface water drainage systems and flood protection works and to the issuance of bonds for the purpose of paying for the property and improvements necessary for all aspects of the management of these systems whereas the city of fairway kansas by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas may exempt itself from the provisions of a statutory enactment that is not uniformly applicable to all cities and may adopt substitute and additional provisions thereto  and whereas the water pollution control act ksa 123101 et seq is applicable to the city but not uniformly applicable to all cities  now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas the city by virtue of the powers vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself and make inapplicable to it  123104 123105 123106 and 123107 of the kansas statutes annotated which apply to the city acting as a city of the second class and which are not uniformly applicable to all cities and the city hereby provides further substitute and additional provisions as set forth herein definitions for the purpose of this charter the following words and phrases shall have the meaning ascribed to them in this section a person shall mean any person firm corporation association partnership political unit or organization b sewer sewer system and sewer systems shall mean surface water and storm sewers that exist at the time this charter adopted or that are hereafter established and all appurtenances necessary in the maintenance operation regulation and improvement of the same including but not limited to pumping stations  enclosed storm sewers  outfall sewers  surface drains  street curb and alley improvements associated with storm or surface water c improvements  natural and manmade wetlands  channels  ditches  rivers  streams  other storm water conveyances  detention and retention facilities  and other flood control facilities and works for the collection conveyance pumping treating controlling managing and disposing of water carried pollutants or storm or surface water d storm water customer shall mean the owner of any real property served or benefited whether voluntarily or involuntarily by the function of any sewer sewer system or sewer systems which captures controls conveys discharges manages or regulates the flow or water quality of storm and surface waters within and from the city or is served or benefited by the administration activities and operation of the storm water management program of the city this service or benefit shall include but not be limited to capturing controlling conveying discharging improving managing and regulating the flow and water quality of storm and surface water from a property or from other properties situated at higher or lower elevations that might otherwise be subservient in right and the administrative planning technical regulatory and enforcement actions necessary to provide these services andor benefits e storm water management program shall mean all aspects of work necessary to perform and provide storm and surface water services in the city including but not limited to administration planning engineering operations maintenance best management practices control measures public education citizen participation regulation and enforcement protection and capital improvement of sewer systems and facilities plus such nonoperating expenses as reserves and bond debt service coverage associated with provision of the storm water management program sewer systems  powers of the city the city shall have all powers necessary or convenient to plan study design alter enlarge extend improve construct reconstruct develop redevelop operate maintain protect manage and regulate and enforce the proper use of a sewer system or sewer systems including the powers that the city may from time to time establish by way of ordinances andor resolutions adopted by the governing body of the city and including but not by way of limitation the following powers a to impose service user impact in lieu of construction buy in and plan review and inspection fees special assessments system development and other charges andor taxes on storm water customers the method of calculating and fixing these charges andor taxes shall be as established by regular ordinances or by rules and regulations heretofore or hereafter adopted  b to provide that charges andor taxes authorized in subparagraph a above may be certified by the city clerk to the county clerk of johnson county kansas to be placed on the tax roll for collection subject to the same penalties and to be collected in like manner as taxes  c to use the proceeds of the charges andor taxes authorized in subparagraph above together with any other available revenues to pay the costs of the storm water management program including but not limited to the costs to plan study design engineer and operate the storm water management program and to plan study design engineer alter enlarge extend improve construct reconstruct develop redevelop operate maintain manage protect acquire real or personal property by purchase lease donation condemnation or otherwise for and regulate and enforce the use of a sewer system or sewer systems  d to use and to pledge the proceeds of the charges andor taxes authorized in subparagraph a above and any available taxes to pay the principal and interest on general obligation or revenue bonds heretofore or hereafter issued  and pending the issuance of the general obligation bonds or revenue bonds to issue temporary financing for these purposes  e to contract with agencies of the federal government the state of kansas other states counties cities drainage districts public bodies of the state or other states or with any person to jointly plan study design alter enlarge extend improve construct reconstruct develop redevelop operate maintain protect acquire real or personal property by purchase lease donation condemnation or otherwise for a sewer system or sewer systems  regulate the use of a sewer system or sewer systems  and to plan study design engineer operate administer maintain and manage the storm water management program  f to contract with agencies of the federal government the state of kansas other states counties cities drainage districts public bodies of the state or other states or with any person for receiving and treating storm or surface water from outside the limits of the city  g to carry out the storm water management program including but not limited to the power to plan study engineer design administer manage maintain and operate the storm water management program and to plan study design engineer alter enlarge extend improve construct reconstruct develop redevelop operate maintain manage protect acquire real or personal property by purchase lease donation condemnation or otherwise for and regulate the use of sewer system or sewer systems within or outside the city  h to borrow money and to apply for and accept advances loans grants contributions or any other form of financial assistance from the federal government the state of kansas other states counties cities drainage districts or any other public body for the purposes of this act and the city may when contracting with the federal government for financial assistance include in any contract the conditions imposed pursuant to federal law as the city may deem reasonable and appropriate  i to under the authority granted herein establish a storm and surface water utility to be accounted for as a separate enterprise fund or special revenue fund of the city as deemed reasonable and appropriate by the governing body of the city  and j to utilize any mechanism deemed reasonable and appropriate by the governing body of the city to deliver billings to storm water customers for services rules and regulations authorized  billing and collection of charges andor taxes the city shall have the power by ordinance or resolution to adopt rules and regulations that shall relate to the management and operation of its storm water management program and sewer system or sewer systems  the method of calculating and fixing the charges andor taxes applicable to properties served by the sewer system or sewer systems or activities associated therewith  security for the payment thereof and methods and rules of collection  and the disposition of the revenue therefrom in the event any person by the citys sewer system or sewer systems shall neglect fail or refuse to pay service fees fixed by the governing body of the city as authorized by rules and regulations adopted under the authority of this section and if a billing system has been established for the delivery and collection of service fees the city may take any action authorized by law to collect any fees that are due and owing issuance of sewer system revenue bonds  requirements a the governing body of the city shall have the power to use any unencumbered municipal revenues or to issue revenue bonds from time to time in its discretion without an election to finance the planning altering enlarging extending improving constructing and reconstructing of a sewer system or sewer systems under this charter bonds shall be made payable as to both principal and interest solely from the income proceeds revenues and funds of the city derived from or held in connection with its sewer system or sewer systems  provided however that payment of these bonds both as to principal and interest may be further secured by a pledge of other unencumbered municipal revenues and of any loan grant or contribution from the federal government the state of kansas other states counties cities drainage districts public bodies of the state or other states or any person b bonds issued under this section shall constitute an indebtedness within the meaning of any constitution or statutory debt limitation or restriction and shall not be subject to the provisions of any other law relating to the authorization issuance or sale of bonds bonds issued under the provisions of this charter declared to be issued for an essential public and governmental purpose and together with interest thereon and income therefrom shall be exempted from all taxes c bonds issued under this section shall be authorized by ordinance or resolution of the governing body and may be issued in one or more series and shall bear such date or dates be payable on demand or mature at such time or times bear interest at such rate or rates not exceeding the maximum rate of interest prescribed by ksa 101009 be in such denomination or denominations be in such form have such rank or priority be executed in such manner and be subject to such terms of redemption with or without premium be secured in such manner and have such other characteristics as may be provided by such ordinance or resolution d pending the issuance of revenue bonds authorized by this charter the governing body of the city may issue revenue anticipation bonds of the city for the purpose of providing interim financing for a project these revenue anticipation bonds being payable from revenue bonds issued to provide permanent financing for activities authorized by this charter the income proceeds revenues and funds of the city derived from or held in connection with its sewer system or sewer systems powers supplemental and additional the power granted herein with respect to the storm water management program including but not limited to the power to plan study design engineer alter enlarge extend improve construct reconstruct develop redevelop operate maintain manage protect acquire real or personal property by purchase lease donation condemnation or otherwise for and regulate the use of a sewer system or sewer systems and to issue bonds shall be supplemental to and not amendatory of the provisions of all other laws heretofore or hereafter in force and shall not be construed to limit the citys authority under the provisions of any other laws severability in the event that any portion or section of this charter determined to be invalid illegal or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction that decision shall not in any manner affect the remaining portions or sections of this ordinance or chapter which shall remain in full force and effect publication this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the office city newspaper effective date  filing this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless within 60 days of its final publication a petition signed by a number of electors of the city of fairway equal to not less than ten percent of the number of electors who voted at the last preceding regular city election shall be filed in the office of the city clerk of fairway demanding an election on the charter ordinance in which case the charter ordinance shall become effective only if and when approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas with not less than twothirds of members elect voting in favor thereof the 26 day of july 2004 charter ordinance no 19 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 124112 and any and all amendments thereto of the code for municipal courts relating to assessment of costs in municipal court and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject whereas the city of fairway kansas by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas may exempt itself from the provisions of a statutory enactment that is not uniformly applicable to all cities and may adopt substitute and additional provisions on the same subject  and whereas ksa 124112 et seq is part of an entire statutory enactment the kansas procedure for municipal courts that is applicable to the city but not uniformly applicable to all cities  now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas the city by virtue of the powers vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt itself and make inapplicable to it of the kansas statutes annotated which apply to the city acting as a city of the second class and which are not uniformly applicable to all cities and the city hereby provides further substitute and additional provisions as set forth herein the governing body as a revenue producing measure shall provide by ordinance for the assessment of a portion of the costs and fees in municipal court publication this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the office city newspaper effective date  filing this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless within 60 days of its final publication a petition signed by a number of electors of the city of fairway equal to not less than ten percent of the number of electors who voted at the last preceding regular city election shall be filed in the office of the city clerk of fairway demanding an election on the charter ordinance in which case the charter ordinance shall become effective only if and when approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas with not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof the 13th day of july 2009 charter ordinance no 20 a charter ordinance amending and repealing charter ordinance no 10 exempting the city of fairway kansas from ksa 124112 relating to the assessment of costs associated with the municipal court be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas by the power vested in it by of the kansas constitution hereby elects to amend existing of charter relating to the assessment of costs associated with the municipal court and add supplemental provisions on the same subject that of charter is hereby amended to read as follows 1 the following schedule of costs assessments and fees are established for the administration of justice in the municipal court of fairway kansas a costs may be assessed for each complaint issued for the violation of any city ordinance except in those cases where the defendant is found not guilty each ordinance violation shall be considered a separate complaint for purposes of assessing court costs  b the court may assess a fee for each warrant issued to arrest a defendant who has failed to appear in court or failed to satisfy the orders of the court  c a monitoring fee may be assessed against a defendant in any case in which the municipal court judge orders said defendant placed on probation or parole  d a monitoring fee may be assessed against a defendant in any case in which the defendant is placed on diversion or given a suspended sentence  e a fee may be assessed for the operation of the victim assistance program or when restitution is ordered by the court  f a fee may be assessed for processing a motion for expungement or motion to set aside judgment or for entry of a nunc pro tunc order  g a fee may be assessed against the defendant upon conviction in each case for which the municipal court judge appoints counsel all complaints against an individual arising from the same incident shall be treated as one case in determining this assessment  h a fee may be assessed against persons convicted of or diverted from ordinance violations  i a fee may be assessed for fingerprinting persons as required by statute  j a daily incarceration fee may be assessed against a defendant for each day of incarceration pursuant to an order of the municipal court judge  k a fee may be assessed for the processing of returned checks  l costs assessments and fees shall be assessed as may be required by state statutes  m a fee may be assessed in any case where the defendant has been charged with violation of the kansas automobile injury reparations act ksa 403101 et seq and amendments thereto and the complaint is dismissed after the defendant produces evidence of financial security insurance coverage for the motor vehicle operated prior to the court date 2 the specific amount of the abovementioned court costs assessments and fees shall be established by the judge of the municipal court such costs assessments and fees may be revised as necessary by the court copies of the current court costs assessments and fees shall be on file in the offices of the city clerk and the municipal court clerk 3 such costs assessments and fees may be assessed as part of a judgment diversion agreement or order and if assessed shall be collected by the municipal court clerk 4 the costs assessments and fees assessed pursuant to this section shall be separate from and in addition to any other costs assessments fees fines restitution penalties or judgments imposed that existing of charter is hereby repealed this is a charter shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after the final publication unless within sixty 60 days of its final publication a petition signed by a number of electors of the city of fairway equal to not less than ten percent 10% of the number of electors who voted at the last preceding regular city election shall be filed in the office of the city clerk of fairway demanding an election on the charter in which case the charter become effective only if and when approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body  with not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 12 day of march 2007 charter ordinance no 21 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 252108a relating to primary elections and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway by virtue of the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to and does exempt itself and make inapplicable to it ksa 252108a which applies to this city but is part of an enactment which does not apply uniformly to all cities there shall be a primary election of city officers on the tuesday preceding by five weeks the first tuesday in april of every year that the city of fairway has a city election except as otherwise provided in no primary election of city officers shall be held unless by holding such primary one or more persons will be eliminated as candidates for office in the event there are not more than two candidates for any one office the names of the candidates for such office shall not appear on the primary election ballots and there shall be no primary election for such office but the names of such candidates shall be placed on the general city election ballot two candidates for each position shall advance to the general election this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this charter ordinance shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body  not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof the 14 day of september 2009 charter ordinance no 22 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 121808 and ksa 121809 relating to the repair of sidewalks and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas fairway code charter ordinances the city of fairway by virtue of the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to and does exempt itself and make inapplicable to it ksa which apply to this city but are part of an enactment which does not apply uniformly to all cities it shall be the duty of the owner of the abutting property to keep the sidewalk in repair  provided however that the city may construct and make any and all repairs and perform any maintenance necessary to sidewalks within the city at the citys expense after providing notice to the owner of the abutting property or its agent if known five 5 days prior to constructing the sidewalks making any repairs or performing any maintenance thereto repairs may be made by force account or by contract and an account of the cost thereof shall be kept and reported to the governing body the city may by ordinance levy a special assessment against the lot or piece of land abutting on the sidewalk so repaired for the cost of repairs and if the abutting property owner does not pay the assessment within thirty days upon the city clerk mailing to the owner or his or her agent if known a printed or written notice of the amount of such repairs the full amount shall be certified by the city clerk to the county clerk to be put on the tax rolls for collection like other taxes the temporary financing of repairs may be borne by the city out of the fund for maintaining streets or out of the general fund or general improvement fund nothing in this preclude the use of the procedure provided by ksa or any statute relating to the construction repair or reconstruction of sidewalks of this charter ordinance shall be codified in by separate ordinance this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this charter ordinance shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body  not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof the 13 day of may 2013 charter ordinance no 23 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of l 201 chapter 88 relating to the filling of governing body vacancies be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas the city of fairway kansas by virtue of the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects and does exempt itself and make inapplicable to it l 201 relating to the filling of governing body vacancies which enactment applies to this city but does not apply uniformly to all cities this charter ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this charter ordinance shall take effect 61 days after final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this 12th day of april 2016 charter ordinance no 24 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 14103 ksa 14201 ksa 14205 ksa 192646 and ksa 252108a relating to the creation of wards the election of officers their terms of office transitions to november elections the appointment of officers and nomination petitions  and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject  and repealing charter ordinance no 7 charter ordinance no 17 and charter ordinance no 21 the city of fairway kansas by the power vested in it by of the kansas constitution hereby elects to and does exempt itself and make inapplicable to it the provisions of ksa 14103 ksa 14201 ksa 14205 ksa 192646 and ksa 252108a that apply to this city but are parts of enactments which do not apply uniformly to all cities the city of fairway shall be divided into four wards which shall be established by ordinance the wards shall be as equal in population as possible and the territory of each ward shall be contiguous and compact no ordinance redefining wards shall become effective less than 30 days prior to the next regular city election the governing body of the city of fairway shall consist of a mayor and eight council members two council members from each ward the mayor and council members shall have terms of four years and until successors are elected and qualified the terms of governing body positions expiring in april 201 shall be extended till and expire on the second monday in january of 201 when the city officials elected in the november 2017 general election take office the terms of governing body positions expiring in april 201 shall be extended till and expire on the second monday in january of 202 when the city officials elected in the november 2019 general election take office a general election of city officers shall take place on the tuesday succeeding the first monday in november 2017 succeeding elections shall be held every two years on the tuesday succeeding the first monday in november for all governing body positions having a term that expires on the second monday of the immediately following january the mayor shall by and with the consent of the city council appoint a municipal judge of the municipal court a chief of police a city clerk a city attorney and may appoint a city engineer police officers and any other officers deemed necessary officers appointed and confirmed shall hold an initial term of office not to exceed one year and until their successors are appointed and qualified the council shall by ordinance specify the duties and compensation of the office holders and by ordinance may abolish any office created by the council whenever deemed expedient appointed officers may be removed by the mayor by and with the consent of the city council or upon a motion by a member of the city council that is adopted by at least a 23 majority vote of the city council all elected officers shall be qualified electors of the city of fairway all appointed officers shall be residents of either the state of kansas or the state of missouri and of douglas county kansas franklin county kansas or one of the nine counties served by the midamerica regional council provided that the city attorney must be admitted to practice law in the state of kansas and be in good standing and the city engineer must hold an active kansas professional engineering license if any officer shall change residence and no longer meets the residency or professional requirements set forth above a vacancy shall be created in such office the clerk shall enter every appointment to office and the date thereof on the journal of the proceedings the city council may require all city officers elected or appointed to take and subscribe an oath and give bonds and security for the faithful performance of their duties no primary election of city officers shall be held unless by holding such primary one or more persons will be eliminated as candidates for office in the event there are not more than two candidates for any one office the names of the candidates for such office shall not appear on the primary election ballots and there shall be no primary election for such office but the names of such candidates shall be placed on the general city election ballot in the event that there are more than two candidates for one office their names shall appear on the primary election ballots and the two candidates receiving the most votes shall advance to the general election in accordance with ksa 25205 and amendments thereto any person may become a candidate for city office elected at large by having filed on their behalf a nomination petition or a declaration of candidacy accompanied by any fee required by law the nomination petition must be signed by 3% of the qualified electors of the city of fairway kansas all elections for the city of fairway kansas shall be nonpartisan charter charter charter are hereby repealed this charter be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this charter take effect 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed requiring a referendum to be held on the ordinance as provided by c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case this charter become effective upon approval by the majority of electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof this 12th day of september 2016 charter ordinance no 25 a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 14570 and ksa 14571 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject relating to public improvements and the issuance of bonds for the purpose of paying for said improvements whereas of the constitution of the state of kansas the act provides that cities may exercise certain home rule powers including passing charter ordinances which exempt such cities from nonuniform enactments of the kansas legislature  and whereas the city of fairway kansas the city is a city as defined in the act duly created and organized under the laws of the state of kansas  and whereas ksa 14570 and ksa 14571 are part of an enactment of the kansas legislature ksa 14570 et seq relating to public improvements and the issuance of bonds for such purposes which enactment is applicable to the city but is not uniformly applicable to all cities within the state of kansas  and whereas the governing body of the city the governing body desires by charter ordinance to exempt the city from the provisions of ksa 14570 and ksa 14571 and to provide substitute and additional provisions therefor now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of fairway kansas exemption  the city by virtue of the powers vested in it by the act hereby elects to exempt itself from and make inapplicable to it the provisions of ksa 14570 and ksa 14571 and shall be governed by the following substitute and additional provisions contained herein master plan for public improvements whenever the city administrator or their designee has filed with the governing body a master capital improvements plan the plan for the physical development of the city and city facilities including but not limited to the acquisition of land necessary therefore the acquisition of equipment vehicles or other personal property to be used in relation thereto or the assumption and payment of benefit district indebtedness previously created for public improvements and which plan may require a number of years to execute and such plan is approved by the governing body the city is hereby authorized to issue its general obligation bonds the bonds in an amount sufficient to carry out such plan and associated costs procedure for issuance of bonds before any bonds are authorized or issued pursuant to this charter the city shall adopt a resolution specifying the amount of such bonds and the purpose of the issuance thereof severability if any provision or section of this charter deemed or ruled unconstitutional or otherwise illegal or invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction such illegality or invalidity shall not affect any other provision of this charter such instance this charter be construed and enforced as if such illegal or invalid provision had not been contained herein effective date this charter be published once a week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper and shall take effect sixty 60 days after final publication unless a petition signed by a number of electors of the city equal to not less than ten percent 10% of the number of electors who voted at the last preceding regular city election shall be filed in the office of the city clerk demanding that this charter submitted to a vote of the electors in which event this charter take effect when approved by a majority of the electors voting at an election held for such purpose passed with at least a twothirds  23  vote of the entire governing body of the city of fairway kansas on  and approved and signed by the mayor a charter ordinance exempting the city of fairway kansas from the provisions of ksa 14103 ksa 14201 ksa 14205 ksa 192646 ksa 252108a and ksa 252110a relating to the creation of wards the election of officers their terms of office transitions to november elections the appointment of officers and nomination petitions  and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject  and repealing charter ordinance no 24 the city of fairway kansas by the power vested in it by of the kansas constitution hereby elects to and does exempt itself and make inapplicable to it the provisions of ksa 14103 ksa 14201 ksa 14205 ksa 192646 ksa 252108a and ksa 2110a that apply to this city but are parts of enactments that do not apply uniformly to all cities the city of fairway shall be divided into four wards that shall be established by ordinance the wards shall be as equal in population as possible and the territory of each ward shall be contiguous and compact no ordinance redefining wards shall become effective less than 30 days prior to the next regular city election the governing body of the city of fairway shall consist of a mayor and eight council members two council members from each ward the mayor and council members shall have terms of four years and until successors are elected and qualified the terms of governing body positions expiring in april 201 shall be extended till and expire on the second monday in january of 202 when the city officials elected in the november 2019 general election take office elections shall be held every two years on the tuesday succeeding the first monday in november in that year for all governing body positions having a term that expires on the second monday of the immediately following january the mayor by and with the consent of the city council shall appoint office holders for such offices as the city council has established by ordinance specifying the duties of the office holder officers appointed and confirmed shall hold the office for an initial term not to exceed one year and until their successors are appointed and qualified the council by ordinance may abolish any office created by the council whenever deemed expedient appointed officers may be removed by the mayor or upon a motion by a member of the city council that is adopted by at least a 23 majority vote of the city council appointed officers removed by the mayor may request that their removal be considered by the city council in which case the affirmative vote of a majority of the entire membership of the city council shall be required to retain the appointed officer such requests must be made to the city administrator within the 30 day period following removal and the city council shall act upon the request within 31 days following its receipt all elected officers shall be qualified electors of the city of fairway all appointed officers shall be residents of johnson wyandotte leavenworth miami douglas or franklin county in the state of kansas  or jackson clay platte or cass county in the state of missouri  provided that the city attorney must be admitted to practice law in the state of kansas and be in good standing and the city engineer must hold an active kansas professional engineering license if any officer shall change residence and no longer meets the residency or professional requirements set forth above a vacancy shall be created in that office the clerk shall enter every appointment to office and the date thereof on the journal of the proceedings the city council may require all city officers elected or appointed to take and subscribe an oath and give bonds and security for the faithful performance of their duties no primary election of city officers shall be held unless by holding the primary one or more persons will be eliminated as candidates for office in the event there are not more than two candidates for any one office the names of the candidates for that office shall not appear on the primary election ballots and there shall be no primary election for that office but the names of such candidates shall be placed on the general city election ballot in the event that there are more than two candidates for one office their names shall appear on the primary election ballots and the two candidates receiving the most votes shall advance to the general election any person may become a candidate for city office elected at large by having filed on their behalf in accordance with ksa 25205 and amendments thereto a nomination petition or a declaration of candidacy accompanied by any fee required by law the nomination petition must be signed by 3% of the qualified electors of the city of fairway kansas any person may become a candidate for city office elected by ward by having filed on their behalf in accordance with ksa 25205 and amendments thereto a nomination petition or a declaration of candidacy accompanied by any fee required by law the nomination petition must be signed by at least 3% of the qualified electors of the ward all elections for the city of fairway kansas shall be nonpartisan charter is hereby repealed this charter be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this charter take effect 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed requiring a referendum to be held on the ordinance as provided by c3
